perturbation.original_text:
III. Time of Payment

(a) Each payment for a particular calendar month shall be due no later than the (20th) day of the subsequent calendar month.

(b) The Licensee shall calculate the license fee payable to the Licensor for each month based on the Monthly Notional Volume  bands for that pay period and shall pay the Licensor accordingly. In no event shall the amount payable by the Licensor be  less than the amount recorded by the Licensee as being traded with the Licensed Technology multiplied by the applicable  Fees set forth above.
perturbation.changed_text:
III. Time of Payment

(a) Each payment for a particular calendar month shall be due no later than the (20th) day of the subsequent calendar month.

(b) The Licensee shall calculate the license fee payable to the Licensor for each month based on the Monthly Notional Volume  bands for that pay period and shall pay the Licensor accordingly. In no event shall the amount payable by the Licensor be  less than the amount recorded by the Licensee as being traded with the Licensed Technology multiplied by the applicable  Fees set forth above.

(c) Notwithstanding the above clauses, the Licensee shall have an extended payment period of 45 days from the end of each calendar month for all payments due under this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: A new clause (c) is added to Section V, contradicting the payment deadline specified in clause (a). Clause (a) states that payments are due by the 20th of the subsequent month, while clause (c) allows for a 45-day payment period. This creates ambiguity and uncertainty regarding the actual payment due date, which could lead to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: XXI  EFFECT OF TERMINATION    Upon termination of this Agreement: for any reason (a) the rights and licenses granted to Licensee pursuant to this Agreement will  automatically terminate, and (b) Licensee shall, within five (5) days, ship to Licensor all Licensed Technology, API's Documentation with respect  to the Licensed Technology and other Confidential Information in Licensee's possession or control, and an officer of Licensee shall certify in  writing that Licensee as complied with the provisions of this Section. All of the Licensor's rights under this Agreement shall survive termination of  this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
XXI  EFFECT OF TERMINATION    Upon termination of this Agreement: for any reason (a) the rights and licenses granted to Licensee pursuant to this Agreement will  automatically terminate, and (b) Licensee shall, within five (5) days, ship to Licensor all Licensed Technology, API's Documentation with respect  to the Licensed Technology and other Confidential Information in Licensee's possession or control, and an officer of Licensee shall certify in  writing that Licensee as complied with the provisions of this Section. All of the Licensor's rights under this Agreement shall survive termination of  this Agreement.

Notwithstanding the above, in the event of termination due to Licensee's breach, Licensee shall have a period of 30 days to transfer the Licensed Technology to a mutually agreed upon third party before the termination becomes fully effective.
perturbation.explanation: An additional clause is added to Article XXI that gives the Licensee 30 days to transfer the Licensed Technology to a third party despite the rights and license being terminated immediately. This directly contradicts the initial statement that upon termination, all rights automatically terminate. This creates an exception with unclear parameters (mutually agreed-upon third party) that undermines the original intent of immediate termination.

perturbation.original_text:
II. Additional Restrictions. The Licensee expressly agrees and acknowledges that, notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary,  Licensee is not licensed to, and Licensee expressly agrees that it shall not(and shall not permit any third party to);

(f) directly or indirectly, reverse engineer, reverse assemble, disassemble or decompile all and/or part of the Licensed  Technology, or otherwise attempt to discover any source code, algorithms, trade secrets or other proprietary rights  embedded in or relating to the Licensed Technology by any means whatsoever (except and solely to the extent that applicable law prohibits reverse engineering restrictions), nor shall it knowingly permit any other individual or corporation,  association, partnership, limited liability Licensee, joint venture, joint stock or other Licensee, business trust, trust,  organization, governmental authority or other entity of any kind to do so.
perturbation.explanation: An exception clause is added to Article II Section II (f) regarding reverse engineering. The original text strictly prohibits reverse engineering, but the added clause states the Licensee *can* reverse engineer for compatibility purposes. This creates a contradiction, as the Licensee is both prohibited and permitted to reverse engineer, depending on the purpose.
